verses.verse: And Job <WH347> again took <WH3254> up his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559>,
As God <WH410> liveth <WH2416>, who hath taken away <WH5493> my right <WH4941>, And the Almighty <WH7706>, who hath vexed <WH4843> my soul <WH5315>:
(For my life <WH5397> is yet whole <WH5750> in me <WH7307>, And the spirit of God <WH433> is in my nostrils <WH639>);
Surely my lips <WH8193> shall not speak <WH1696> unrighteousness <WH5766>, Neither shall my tongue <WH3956> utter <WH1897> deceit <WH7423>.
Far be it <WH2486> from me that I should justify <WH6663> you <WH1478>: Till I die I will not put away <WH5493> mine integrity from me <WH8538>.
My righteousness <WH6666> I hold <WH2388> fast <WH7503>, and will not let it go: My heart <WH3824> shall not reproach <WH2778> me so long as I live <WH3117>.
Let mine enemy <WH341> be as the wicked <WH7563>, And let him that riseth up <WH6965> against me be as the unrighteous <WH5767>.
For what is the hope <WH8615> of the godless <WH2611>, though he get him gain <WH1214>, When God <WH433> taketh away <WH7953> his soul <WH5315>?
Will God <WH410> hear <WH8085> his cry <WH6818>, When trouble <WH6869> cometh upon him <WH935>?
Will he delight <WH6026> himself in the Almighty <WH7706>, And call <WH7121> upon God <WH433> at all times <WH6256>?
I will teach <WH3384> you concerning the hand <WH3027> of God <WH410>; That which is with the Almighty <WH7706> will I not conceal <WH3582>.
Behold <WH2372>, all ye yourselves have seen it <WH1892>; Why then are ye become altogether vain <WH1891>?
This is the portion <WH2506> of a wicked <WH7563> man <WH120> with God <WH410>, And the heritage <WH5159> of oppressors <WH6184>, which they receive <WH3947> from the Almighty <WH7706>:
If his children <WH1121> be multiplied <WH7235>, it is for <WH3926> the sword <WH2719>; And his offspring <WH6631> shall not be satisfied <WH7646> with bread <WH3899>.
Those that remain <WH8300> of him shall be buried <WH6912> in death <WH4194>, And his widows <WH490> shall make no lamentation <WH1058>.
Though he heap up <WH6651> silver <WH3701> as the dust <WH6083>, And prepare <WH3559> raiment <WH4403> as the clay <WH2563>;
He may prepare <WH3559> it <WH6662>, but the just shall put it on <WH3847>, And the innocent <WH5355> shall divide <WH2505> the silver <WH3701>.
He buildeth <WH1129> his house <WH1004> as the moth <WH6211>, And as a booth <WH5521> which the keeper <WH5341> maketh <WH6213>.
He lieth down <WH7901> rich <WH6223>, but he shall not be gathered <WH622> to his fathers <WH6491>; He openeth his eyes <WH5869>, and he is not.
Terrors <WH1091> overtake <WH5381> him like waters <WH4325>; A tempest <WH5492> stealeth him away <WH1589> in the night <WH3915>.
The east <WH6921> wind carrieth him away <WH5375>, and he departeth <WH3212>; And it sweepeth <WH8175> him out of his place <WH4725>.
For God shall hurl <WH7993> at him <WH2550>, and not spare: He would fain <WH1272> flee <WH1272> out of his hand <WH3027>.
Men shall clap <WH5606> their hands <WH3709> at him <WH8319>, And shall hiss him out of his place <WH4725>.
